website_summaries.verdict: The comfortable and sturdy shoulder on this camera strap makes it good for outdoor or active shoots.
pros: Strap relieves strain on your neck
Allows you to wear a camera for several hours without getting neck pain
cons: The stabilizing underarm strap is a little awkward to use
You will want to pay attention when you order for left or right handed shooting

customer_reviews.title: Black Rapid straps are the best. I own several and the Breathe Sport is ...
customer_reviews.text: Black Rapid straps are the best. I own several and the Breathe Sport is the best one yet. Comfortable and there are no worries about the strap slipping off or the camera unscrewing from the strap. Great product as usual from Black Rapid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable Strap With Some Issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strap for hiking and active photography and I was disappointed compared to previous iterations of Blackrapid straps. The stabilizer strap is very awkward and can easily come off the main strap. Also, cam locks are bit tough to move around especially if you want to make a quick shot and your camera is fixed with these locks. Other than these two issues, this is a highly durable, high quality strap.
customer_reviews.author: my_review

customer_reviews.title: High quality and secure
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera strap. Very heavy duty and the threaded carabiner clip with lock is excellent when on the move. The padding is comfortable and easy to adjust and lock the camera in place. I have used this while bike riding and while skateboarding and have never had an issue with it feeling like it will come loose. The under arm strap is a nice feature to have but it can feel awkward to some people. What is great though is it easily detaches so if you don't like it then it can be easily removed. Overall I think this was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Worth spending the extra money for this if you carry a camera for extended periods.
customer_reviews.text: I love this strap. I bought a knock-off the first time around because I just thought this price was rediculous. However, I eventually caved and purchased this. It is soooo much better than the knock-off. I can put this on and wear it all day without any issues. It is very easy to access my camera and you can also adjust the clips to "lock" your camera in place on the strap so it hangs where you want it. Very nice strap. I generally carry a Nikon 7200 with an 18-200 lense.
customer_reviews.author: BrownySquare

customer_reviews.title: Works Good but Glaring Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Functionality wise, this is a good product; however, I've had nothing but trouble with the under arm strap in the few times I've used it. It attaches with a hook on one side instead of a quick releases like the other side. Now after only using this nearly $80 strap only 3 times, I can't find the under arm part. Why was this ever designed in such a way the moment you release it, the thing can fall off? It's an obvious design flaw. If they got rid of the hood and used a real release, it would be perfect, but now I have an $80 harness that's worse than a paperweight because it can't even hold down paper.
customer_reviews.author: Elemino Musgrove

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Accessible
customer_reviews.text: This is a HUGE improvement over the basic camera strap that comes with most cameras. It rides comfortably on my shoulder without weighing down on the back of my neck. It's very quick and easy to slide the camera up from my hip (where it rests with this strap) to eye level to start shooting. The price does seem a bit high compared to competitors and given that it's just a simple shoulder strap, but I'm definitely glad to have it and wishing I had purchased something like this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: I love hiking and backpacking. I like to have my camera with me ready to shoot at all times and this is an excellent and very comfortable solution to the common neck strap. It holds the camera securely and adds an added backup strap if for some reason it would disconnect from the mounting screw. However, I can't really see that happening as long as it is tightened properly. Love this strap.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W. Sharbon

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the BlackRapid sport strap.
customer_reviews.text: super comfortable. Don't really notice it's there. Camera is secure and sitting properly for quick draw. I got the regular size. Not slim. I'm 6'2" tall and 205 lb. fits me just fine. The little chinga that attaches to the camera base and clip thing are very secure. You won't be disappointed if you order this. I also ordered the JOBY for that extra security but I don't really need it. I do have it attached thou.
customer_reviews.author: Mike J

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I used it with my Cannon 6D MarkII during my Patagonia trip. Since I joined a tour and I did not have time to take my camera in and out frequently, I simple used the strap with my camera during all my hikes (except when it was raining heavily). It worked nicely and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Secure, comfortable, easy to use and very durable!
customer_reviews.text: This camera strap is AMAZING! It keeps the camera safely at your side and the slide locks on it can lock the camera at your side and can be easily unlocked and pulled up quickly. I often use it on my 150-600mm lens and it works great! Very secure, very comfortable and hopefully the last camera strap I will have to buy!
customer_reviews.author: BigBadWolfe

customer_reviews.title: Secure and Useful, Awkward Wear?
customer_reviews.text: Kept my camera safe on a few outings now. Only anchored in by the tripod mounting point it has held my camera firm during the awkward process of trying to put it on. I'm still trying to get used to putting it on but other than that works well as intended and allows me to be much more free handed.
customer_reviews.author: Daren

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth the higher cost
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Well made. I had purchased a similar system for a third the price. I got what I paid for. This upgrade relieves me of the worry that my 3 thousand dollar investment is safe.
customer_reviews.author: John Scavetto

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, helps carry my heavy DSLR for a whole day in the field. Only thing, as other reviewers have pointed out, is that the grey plastic part that holds the under arm strap- gets dislocated very easily. This is easily resolved using a small piece of black tape.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wisniak

customer_reviews.title: Quality material. Poor design. Uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I like material and shoulder design. Seems like something that will last. However, the lower under arm strap is uncomfortable and doesnt sit well on the body. Depending on how you adjust it, it can dig into your skin. It kinda sits in my arm pit making it uncomfortable. That being said, it's easy to take off. I'm taking it hiking this weekend to get a full experience with it, but out of the box I do find it over priced for what it is. May send back.
customer_reviews.author: sickofheart

customer_reviews.title: Great, reasonably priced at 75.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, nice slide action to bring the camera up to get the shot. Easy to wear, extra strap under the arm prevents the strap from cutting against your neck. I'm a college TA in a photography lab, and use this often and forget I'm wearing it while helping students with shooting assignments.
customer_reviews.author: W805

customer_reviews.title: excellent product. Ive been using it with a Canon ...
customer_reviews.text: excellent product. Ive been using it with a Canon 100-400, a Canon 180 Macro and occasionally even with the 600mm F4 lens with and without bodies attached. It has survived 4 months now without a dropoff or any sign of wear. I highly recommend this strap. Makes carrying an additional camera very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W. Ramsden

customer_reviews.title: Really liked the older version better
customer_reviews.text: Lost my previous strap which I loved (sad face) so reordered the current version. I really like the weight distribution and ergonomics. However as others have reported the connector under the arm pit comes loose too frequently. Still I'd buy it again. I liked that they added a security strap. Never had an issue with it breaking loose but nice to have the added security.
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: Works well but....
customer_reviews.text: Once you figure out just how to wear this camera strap, it does a good job. However, figuring out how to put it on and how to secure it with the safety strap is not obvious. It times some time to figure it out. THey need to provide better instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Judge

customer_reviews.title: Taking the pain out of my neck and putting the joy back in day-long photography adventures!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this! Crossbody strap takes weight of camera/lens off your neck, making all types of photography excursions more enjoyable. Really love the added security of knowing my camera body is secured to the strap in two locations so my body/lens investment is protected even if one of the mechanisms fail. The underarm strap adds extra comfort and keeps the camera positioned where I want it. Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to put on. I'm a newborn photographer and I don't have to worry about the camera falling/sliding and hitting the baby. It's been secure and very professional looking. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Must to have and nice looking strap
customer_reviews.text: Must to have equipment. Comfortable dslr carry on strap. Nice detailing. Good quality construccion. Nice looking too. Best of all straps I have seen before. This is the second one I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: a fellow photographer recommended I get one of these camera straps
customer_reviews.text: When on a trip to New York, a fellow photographer recommended I get one of these camera straps. It definitely eliminates the strain on the neck from a typical camera strap. I also like that you can easily push the camera around.
customer_reviews.author: Aggie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but....
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, which was my primary goal. One point camera attachment seems likely to inadvertently unscrew. The underarm straps rear attachment is a simple hook which can come off if not actually being used.
customer_reviews.author: Rrmurray

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: The small side strap does not stay connected and falls off frequently. Have only one shoulder strap means that it moves around quite a bit. Works ok even with a heavy camera. If I was going to do it again I would be the version with two shoulder straps.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's incredibly helpful when you're taking pictures and you I'm not using a tripod. It was to take their camera in and out of the camera bag and a hand on it? This is a must to have any professional photographer
customer_reviews.author: pcampbell

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Strap Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the BlackRapid camera strap for a hiking trip in the Lake District (England). The terrain and conditions were challenging, yet the camera was comfortable to carry and the innovative features of the strap made the camera easily accessible. Highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Terrill E. Theman

customer_reviews.title: Safety tether broke in one week.
customer_reviews.text: Casual use, nothing crazy. For the price I am very disappointed. I’m going to try and return this.
customer_reviews.author: Anurekh

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but well worth it
customer_reviews.text: It's a little expensive, but it's worth the money. Transfers the weight of the camera to my shoulder rather than on my neck. Feels very secure and doesn't get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Conner Alderson

customer_reviews.title: Load management
customer_reviews.text: The strap does a great job supporting my camera considering I have a pretty heavy load. ( Sony A7iii paired w the 24-70 GM ). I haven’t done any thorough testing but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Save money and get one!
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent! I have used a cheaper strap for many years but BR strap is 100 times better. Fits much better and material is better. Mfg# is 361005 if anyone wondering.(which is the legit latest model) One that shows in the description is wrong/old.
customer_reviews.author: Klmnooooo

customer_reviews.title: but the functionality is equally as good. I like the additional security with the plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: They've changed the design from the earlier model and have made it more breathable, but the functionality is equally as good. I like the additional security with the plastic clip that prevents unwinding of the fastener. That bit wasn't on the old design.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Design and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a "Used - Like New" item. The box was slightly damaged (caused when the box was opened for the first time). The strap was brand new for all practical purposes. It is very comfortable with 2-1/2 pounds of camera hanging off the end of this strap. It is far superior to the standard strap supplied with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Huge K.

customer_reviews.title: BlackRapid Breathe Sport Camera Strap
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my new BlackRapid Breathe Sport Camera Strap and it arrived the next day as promised. The strap is well constructed and is everything that I heard it is from numerous reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoids shoulder & hand pain and is very safe
customer_reviews.text: Very useful when you are wandering around, avoiding to take with you a camera case or hold it in your hand. As it hangs across your body, your shoulder also doesn’t suffer so much as with the regular string It is also very safe
customer_reviews.author: CrisK

customer_reviews.title: Save your neck with this strap
customer_reviews.text: I had a multi-day shoot with a very heavy camera and this thing saved my neck - literally. It takes some practice putting it on properly, but once you get the hang of it - it makes lugging around a beast of a DSLR much easier -- even for smaller DSLRs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Z

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for all-day camera use
customer_reviews.text: I recently took a week-long trip to Europe, and wanted to have my DSLR (Canon 80D) with me at all times. I was certain that a neck strap would cause me problems for such long periods of time, so I invested in this one. While it is a bit expensive for what it is, I was comfortable carrying my camera around all week long.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Thornton

customer_reviews.title: That Underarm Strap Tho
customer_reviews.text: A great strap! The underarm strap though is designed weird and routinely falls off when putting the strap on or off. Make sure you check to have it before driving away. I'm pretty sure I'll leave it behind somewhere eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product - no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product - no issues. I personally moved to PD Strap - just like it a bit more
customer_reviews.author: Eli Shapurov

customer_reviews.title: Staple
customer_reviews.text: Colleagues/mentor recommended this to me and I love it way better than neck strap that comes with canon/Nikon cameras it secures the heck out of my setup and keeps it close and accessible
customer_reviews.author: Malc_dotcom

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Well, I found this a little expensive but very satisfied with the performance. It is very strong and quality product. The finish is flawless and very high quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Milon Hossain

customer_reviews.title: Glad to be wearing again
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and adjusts nicely. This is my second BR.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkmeister2455

customer_reviews.title: Made well. Worth the $ for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: Made well. Comfortable. Secure. I used it extensively with my Fujifilm X-H1 and 16-55mm in several national parks. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product which is convenient to use. Transferring the camera from hip level to eye is is easy. However, I would be concerned to use it without a safety cord between the camera and the BlackRapid strap.
customer_reviews.author: J Charles Parker II

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and secure
customer_reviews.text: A standard camera strap either goes around your neck or on your shoulder. My camera is HEAVY and I often carry it all day for several days in a row. This strap balances the weight better and provides a wider, softer pad on your shoulder. It also has a safety strap so that the shoulder strap won't slip off.
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with a little duct tape.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, and well built. You will lose the underarm security strap if you don't tape it shut!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Blackrapid Sport, Truly Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Black Rapid strap I’ve owned. I love the way it fits, how it keeps the camera just where I need it to get a quick shot when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Harold M.

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a traditional camera strap
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable compared to traditional camera straps. Easy to adjust, barely even notice the weight of the camera on your shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but as with my older sport model the ...
customer_reviews.text: Thank, Very nice, but as with my older sport model the adjustment of length is crude. I have several of the backpack units that are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: George K.

customer_reviews.title: strap
customer_reviews.text: like it, works well while in standing. when sitting down, it falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, works great for long distance travel
customer_reviews.text: Needed a camera strap for my trip to Italy, I was worried my neck would be in pain from carrying my camera everywhere, so I bought this. This made sure that my back wasn't in pain and walking 7-10 miles per day with my camera strapped on a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Debi Galvin

customer_reviews.title: For sports photographer
customer_reviews.text: Should have this years back. Very comfortable and very quick camera action.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Best strap out there.
customer_reviews.text: This strap is great! No more neck pain from taking pictures all day. It feels more secure on my hip instead of sticking out straight in front of me. I also like how fast I can get the camera to my eye or change a lens without fumbling.
customer_reviews.author: Apricotbell

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! It was a win win at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: hgnelson

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but pro quality.
customer_reviews.text: If you are considering buying this, then you know what it is. Lives up to the hype. Top notch quality, although a bit expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Huncken jr.

customer_reviews.title: Best camera strap on the market!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my BlackRapid straps and the new breathe is a great upgrade!!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this strap
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this strap. Had a previous BlackRapid strap that I liked. I lost that one. But this is a great strap. Use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, takes the strain off the back of neck, camera always ready at your size, wish I had purchased years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Photos7

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera strap! See all the youtube videos for a better idea of how it works. Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvements.
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept but can be improved. Couple of issues I have with it. First, there is a quick release at the top back of the strap without safety. If that gets undone for any reason by accident your camera will fall to the ground. I added a safety strap. Second, I don't like the idea of how it is connected to the camera. It doesn't feel secure and it takes up the tripod mount. I found some solutions myself. After these minor changes i love the product but as I said it could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This device is great. I can lock my camera into place and then run to a different location or lock it into place while I am helping to move people around for a shot and not hit him in the head.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brown

customer_reviews.title: ... is my third Black Rapid Sling and I really enjoy using their product
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Black Rapid Sling and I really enjoy using their product. Well made with great materials.
customer_reviews.author: PubliusH27

customer_reviews.title: Best strap I have owned for my camera
customer_reviews.text: Best strap I have owned for my camera. I carried my camera for two days straight, about 5 hours each day and no neck pain.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kover

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good fit. Solid, sturdy hardware. Easy to adjust. Easily holds my Sony a7rii with battery grip and flash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice, albeit subtle, improvements over the older model. I will never be without one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa V.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Strap.
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best strap in my opinion. A must for a camera with a heavy lens. Very good design and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Herb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This strap has changed the way I use my camera while hiking. It's absolutely incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky K.

customer_reviews.title: $9k Equipment Failure!
customer_reviews.text: Received last week, tightened the mount screw to my camera. Midway through taking picture of my daughters soccer game my D800E and 200mm VRII decided to fall off the connector. This strap is a good idea with terrible execution and major flaws: -The lug that screws into your camera is more than happy to unscrew itself (see above). - The whole system fails if someone unclips the clip on your shoulder (behind you). I can't believe there is no fail safe. -Wanted to love this system but couldn't trust it and it was returned!
customer_reviews.author: Blake H. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Premium Camera Strap
customer_reviews.text: Supreme quality and comfort! Absolute must have for any photographer who will be walking and handholding their camera.
customer_reviews.author: S Missig

customer_reviews.title: Great strap
customer_reviews.text: The sliding feature and the way it locks the camera from flailing around is exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great strap
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and great for hiking. I took off the under arm strap and frankly don't sense any added stability from it. Easy to access the camera on the fly
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best camera strap ever invented
customer_reviews.text: Best camera strap ever invented. I use it to keep my camera secure on hikes while moving & then easy to point & shoot the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in order and fast too. Super happy with my purchase !
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin Tay

customer_reviews.title: Great camera strap for use while on the go
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as they described. Great camera strap for use while on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Janae Cox

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable camera strap
customer_reviews.text: I've only used mine for a day, but already love it. It makes my 70-200 feel weightless and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor design and very
customer_reviews.text: Camera bounces on your hip with no way to stabilising it. Very poor design and very, very expensive. There are much better and cheaper options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best DSLR Shoulder / Neck Strap Available in the market today.
customer_reviews.author: PJ Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product is great, but it shipped without the brad, which meant I wasn't able to secure it while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Corey E. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: The strap continually falls off my left shoulder no matter ...
customer_reviews.text: The strap continually falls off my left shoulder no matter how tight I pull it. You need to have big square muscly shoulders to be able to wear this thing. I'm never buying Black Rapid again.
customer_reviews.author: Padma Sangjay Llamo

product_meta.title: BlackRapid Sport Breathe Original Camera Sling Design, Strap for DSLR, SLR and Mirrorless Cameras
product_meta.description: You will feel at ease with the Black Rapid Sport strap, whether you are hiking in the Himalayas or running along the touch line. Designed for adventurers. The shoulder strap has a wider part on the back to cover the shoulder and distribute the weight evenly. Thanks to its feather-light weight and breathable materials, you can concentrate on the action without worrying about the strap. It is 167cm long and weighs 190g. Comes with a CR-3 sliding carabiner and FR-5 case screw, LOCKSTAR protection, BRAD strap and storage bag.
feature_bullets: Package Dimensions: 110.0 L x 60.0 W x 240.0 H (millimetres)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars254 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
